Any help gratefully received. Cheers.

 [‹ "CBS News 36" sans from the 1960s](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024017/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39919 "Go to previous forum topic") [swirly serif.. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024017/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40619 "Go to next forum topic")
author: miss c

comments.content: That \*may\* be a freeware, rip-off of a commercial font. I don’t have time to check, but looks a lot like Compacta.
I think Haettenschweiler used to come bundled with Windows.

Yep - and [Haettenschweiler](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024017/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haettenschweiler) was an old metal type ages ago.

Edit: I don’t think that Haettenschweiler was bundled with Windows, per se. It _was_ bundled with [lots of MS products](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029024017/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FID=30&FNAME=Haettenschweiler&FVER=2.30), though.
